original: Ewert, Bo Axel Vilhelm, överläkare, Göteborg, f. 4/1/01 i Karlsborg, Ska-rab. 1., av öv:löjtn. Carl Axel E. o. Märtha Stål. G. 31 m. Eva Schmidt. Barn: Ulla f. 32, Märta 37, Lena 39. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 18, stud. v. KTH 19-21, v. Sthlms högsk. 21, med. kand. 25, med. lüc. 30 o. mied. dr 35 i Upps. Stud:res. t. Köpenhamn 32, Oslo 34 o. London 35. Aman. v. fy-siol. inst. i Upps. 25-26, e. o. dito 29, tf. laborator i exper. fysiol. o. med. fysik v. Upps. univ. sexton mån. 26-32, assist :läk. v. Akad. sjukh. i Upps. avd. f. bröstsjukd. 29, dito o. tf. aman. v. dess med. avd. 30, aman. där 33-36, tf. prof. i fysiol. v. Upps. univ. två mån. 31, doc. i exper. patol. där 35-36, e. läk. samt e. o. hosp :läk. v. Ul-leråkers sjukh. tills. c:a två år 31-33, und :läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. 36, tf. över-läk. där 40-45, överläk. v. Vasa sjukh. i Gbg sed. 46. Skr.: avh. o. upps. i fysiol. o. med.
translated: Ewert, Bo Axel Vilhelm, senior physician, Gothenburg, born January 4th, 1901 in Karlsborg, Skaraborg  County, Sweden, first child of Lieutenant Colonel Carl Axel E. and Märtha Stål. Married in 1931 to Eva Schmidt. Children: Ulla b. 1932, Märta b. 1937, Lena b. 1939. Completed high school studies in Stockholm in 1918, studied at the Royal Institute of Technology from 1919-1921, and at Stockholm University from 1921. Graduated with a medical degree in 1925 and completed his medical licentiate in 1930, as well as his medical doctorate in 1935 from Uppsala University. Traveled to Copenhagen in 1932, Oslo in 1934, and London in 1935 for study purposes. Worked as an assistant at the Institute of Physiology in Uppsala from 1925-1926, as well as a temporary laboratory assistant in experimental physiology and medical physics at Uppsala University between 1926-1932, and an assistant physician at the Department of Chest Disease at the University Hospital in Uppsala from 1929. Also, he served as an acting assistant and medical intern in the Medical Department of the same hospital from 1930. He continued as an acting senior physician from 1933-1936 and acted as a professor at the University of Uppsala for two months in 1931. Additionally, he was a docent in experimental pathology there from 1935-1936, as well as a medical doctor and acting hospital physician at Ulleråkers Hospital for about two years from 1931-1933. He finally served as a medical intern at Sahlgr. Hospital in 1936 while acting as a chief physician there from 1940-1945, after which he became a senior physician at Vasa Hospital in Gothenburg from 1946 onwards. He authored several research papers and essays in physiology and medicine.
